text: Standard tourist visa applications take 5–7 business days to process.
Express visa applications take 2–3 business days to process.
A valid passport with at least 6 months remaining before expiry is required.
You need to submit a recent passport-size photograph according to the visa guidelines.
A detailed travel itinerary including flights and accommodation is required.
You must provide proof of sufficient funds for your stay, such as bank statements.
Some visas require a letter of invitation from a host or organization in the destination country.
Visa application fees vary depending on the visa type and country; check the official fee schedule.
After submission, the application is reviewed by a consultant or visa officer. You will receive email updates at each step.
Some visa applications require an in-person or online interview at a consulate or visa center.
You can check the status of your application online using your reference number.
If you need to extend your visa, apply before your current visa expires and follow the extension procedures.
If your visa application is denied, you will receive a reason and can appeal or reapply depending on the country’s rules.
Delays may occur during peak travel seasons or due to incomplete documents. Always submit complete documentation.
Minors traveling with parents may require separate visa applications or parental consent forms.
For group travel, each traveler must submit their own application and required documents.
Some countries require proof of travel insurance covering the duration of your stay.
Certain documents may need to be notarized or translated officially before submission.
If you plan multiple visits, you may apply for a multiple-entry visa. Check eligibility criteria.
For urgent travel, express or priority processing may be available for an additional fee.
